page.title: 12Totternhoe Church
page.content: The parish church of Totternhoe is named after St. Giles, the patron saint of beggars and cripples. It is built of local stone. Services are held every Sunday at 11am. and 6pm. On the second Sunday of the month, services are at 8am. and 11am. with a Family Service at 6pm. The vicar's name is the Rev. Canon Derek Cook. He is vicar of Stanbridge and Tilsworth as well. Average weekly attendance at St. Giles is about eighty. There are about 26 members of the choir and 16 people take it in turn to ring the peel of eight bells. Sunday School meets in the Church Hall at 11am with about 30 children on roll. There are four Sunday School teachers. The Church is very old and the Churchyard is full of graves. There is not much room left to bury people when they die.
